trans-unit.source: How to test a driver at runtime from a Command Prompt
trans-unit.target: How to test a driver at runtime from a Command Prompt

trans-unit.source: The WDK provides device testing components that enable you to test a driver on a test computer on your network.
trans-unit.target: The WDK provides device testing components that enable you to test a driver on a test computer on your network.

trans-unit.source: You can use these components outside of Visual Studio by copying and installing the necessary files.
trans-unit.target: You can use these components outside of Visual Studio by copying and installing the necessary files.

trans-unit.source: You can use these components to run the same collection of device driver tests that are available in Visual Studio to test the features and functions of your driver.
trans-unit.target: You can use these components to run the same collection of device driver tests that are available in Visual Studio to test the features and functions of your driver.

trans-unit.source: Starting in WDK 8.1, you can copy and run the HCK Test Suites on test computers using command scripts.
trans-unit.target: Starting in WDK 8.1, you can copy and run the HCK Test Suites on test computers using command scripts.

trans-unit.source: See [How to run the HCK Test Suites in WDK 8.1](run_the_hck_test_suites_in_the_wdk.md).
trans-unit.target: See [How to run the HCK Test Suites in WDK 8.1](run_the_hck_test_suites_in_the_wdk.md).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Install Visual Studio and the WDK on the computer you use for development.
trans-unit.target: Install Visual Studio and the WDK on the computer you use for development.

trans-unit.source: From Visual Studio, you can configure and provision computers for testing.
trans-unit.target: From Visual Studio, you can configure and provision computers for testing.

trans-unit.source: When you configure the test computer, the WDK driver test framework automatically enables the test computer for remote debugging and transfers the necessary test binaries and support files.
trans-unit.target: When you configure the test computer, the WDK driver test framework automatically enables the test computer for remote debugging and transfers the necessary test binaries and support files.

trans-unit.source: If you have not already done so, follow the instructions in [Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 8.1)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Dn745909)
trans-unit.target: If you have not already done so, follow the instructions in [Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 8.1)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Dn745909)

trans-unit.source: Although it is not recommended, you can also install the necessary test components manually.
trans-unit.target: Although it is not recommended, you can also install the necessary test components manually.

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions to install the [Test Authoring and Execution Framework (TAEF)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh439725) and WDTF on the test computer.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions to install the [Test Authoring and Execution Framework (TAEF)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh439725) and WDTF on the test computer.

trans-unit.source: See [Manually installing and uninstalling TAEF on a test computer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/En-US/Library/Windows/Hardware/hh439627#manual_install_taef) and [Manually installing WDTF on a test computer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/En-US/Library/Windows/Hardware/hh831856#manual_install_wdtf).
trans-unit.target: See [Manually installing and uninstalling TAEF on a test computer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/En-US/Library/Windows/Hardware/hh439627#manual_install_taef) and [Manually installing WDTF on a test computer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/En-US/Library/Windows/Hardware/hh831856#manual_install_wdtf).

trans-unit.source: Instructions
trans-unit.target: Instructions

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Copy the tests to the test computer
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Copy the tests to the test computer

trans-unit.source: Copy the [Device Fundamentals Tests](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/JJ673011) from the computer you use for development.
trans-unit.target: Copy the [Device Fundamentals Tests](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/JJ673011) from the computer you use for development.

trans-unit.source: Copy the folder %ProgramFiles%\\Windows Kits\\8.0\\Testing\\Tests\\Device Fundamentals to the test computer.
trans-unit.target: Copy the folder %ProgramFiles%\\Windows Kits\\8.0\\Testing\\Tests\\Device Fundamentals to the test computer.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Run the tests
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Run the tests

trans-unit.source: The TAEF command to run the tests uses the following syntax:
trans-unit.target: The TAEF command to run the tests uses the following syntax:

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: You must specify the test binary (.dll) or script (.wsc) file.
trans-unit.target: You must specify the test binary (.dll) or script (.wsc) file.

trans-unit.source: The test method (**/name:***<test method>*) is optional.
trans-unit.target: The test method (**/name:***<test method>*) is optional.

trans-unit.source: For the test names and test methods, see the [Device Fundamentals Tests](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/JJ673011).
trans-unit.target: For the test names and test methods, see the [Device Fundamentals Tests](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/JJ673011).

trans-unit.source: For information about specifying test parameters, see [Device Fundamentals Test Parameters](how_to_select_and_configure_the_device_fundamental_tests.md) and [Te.exe Command Options](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh439743) .
trans-unit.target: For information about specifying test parameters, see [Device Fundamentals Test Parameters](how_to_select_and_configure_the_device_fundamental_tests.md) and [Te.exe Command Options](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh439743) .

trans-unit.source: For example, to run all PnP tests in the Devfund\_PnPDTest.dll on a device with a specific device ID.
trans-unit.target: For example, to run all PnP tests in the Devfund\_PnPDTest.dll on a device with a specific device ID.

trans-unit.source: For example, to run PnP Surprise Remove test on a device with a specific device ID.
trans-unit.target: For example, to run PnP Surprise Remove test on a device with a specific device ID.
